The content listing tile gives you lots of flexibility in choosing what kind of content displays, and how it displays. Notice this tile has an "Edit" button since there are additional settings that can be configured.

The first part of setting up a content listing tile uses filters to determine what content displays. These filters function the same as the Collection content type. Content in the tile is updated dynamically as content is added to the site.

The second part is choosing a template, which determines how the content will be displayed.

Filtering the Content

The filtering offers various search filters for you to choose and then limit. Here are some common filters you may apply:

  • Type matches any of Page
  • Review state matches any of Published
  • Sort on Modification Date, Reversed Order

The Preview will show you up to 10 items, so you can be sure that the criteria you set are returning results. Change the Limit value if you only want a few items to display. In the Example, weâ€™ve set it to 5.

Display Modes

Listing view

  • Displays a list of Content including the Title and Description
  • Value set in the Limit determines the number of items that will appear

Summary view

  • Displays content with title and descriptions

Tabular view

  • Displays content in a table
